attributes.action: Make it easier for suffers of crohns and colitis obtain blue badges
attributes.additional_details: I have fatigue and often urgently need to use the bathroom due to 5 resections. On bad days my father has had to take me into work so if I need to pull in anywhere to use the bathroom then I don't have the worry of finding a space. I've already received a parking ticket due to this situation, I  won my appeal. I know I'm not the only suffering with this
attributes.background: We aren't entitled to any benefits including free prescriptions but the least we deserve is not to be in a stressful position in which we find ourselves looking for a parking space to use facilities urgently

rejection.details:
Blue Badges are automatically awarded to people if they receive certain rates of particular benefits, but are not normally awarded because people have a specific condition. Local councils, not the Government or House of Commons, are responsible for deciding who is eligible for a blue badge.

You could start a petition calling for the Government to review the criteria for blue badges, if that's something you'd like to see happen.
